raw_text:
Based on the provided paper, I'll extract the structured information following the guidelines:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Measuring movements out of poverty: Results from IFAD-supported projects",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "IFAD-supported projects",
    "country": null,
    "region": null,
    "target_population": "Rural poor households",
    "program_name_citation": "The International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) has committed to a poverty reduction target of 80 million people moved out of poverty between 2010 and 2015 through IFAD-supported projects",
    "country_citation": null,
    "target_population_citation": "poor rural households"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": false,
      "cash_support_type": null,
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": null
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": false,
      "assets_provided": [],
      "direct_provision": "UNCLEAR",
      "assets_evidence_citation": null
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "poverty reduction",
      "household asset ownership",
      "food security",
      "child malnutrition"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "four new indicators were included in the RMF: (1) household asset ownership index, as a proxy for welfare of target group households; (2) length of hungry season; (3) child malnutrition, as measures of food and nutrition security of target group households and individuals; and (4) number of people moved out of poverty",
    "study_design": "Quasi-experimental",
    "design_evidence_citation": "These ex-post evaluations will employ quasi-experimental designs to better understand the causal chain-and-measure attribution to IFAD",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": true,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2013-2015",
    "sample_size": null,
    "completed": false
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": true,
    "qualitative_methods": ["mixed methods"],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": "where possible, mixed methods designs",
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  }
}
```

This appears to be a methodological paper about IFAD's results measurement framework rather than an evaluation of a specific graduation or cash+asset program. The paper discusses how IFAD measures poverty reduction across its portfolio but does not describe specific intervention components. Therefore, I've marked both cash and asset components as false since no specific program details are provided.
